article: More than 26 million Americans took part in the Vietnam War. More than 58,000 of them died ; over 300,000 were _ , and nearly 2300 were missing and thought dead. Improved _ services saved many soldiers with serious _ that in earlier wars would have been fatal . More than 600 Americans were prisoners of war (POWs).Some POWs spent six years or even _ in North Vietnamese prisons. One of the _ things of the war has been the fate of its veterans .The _ of soldiers from the Vietnam War was not _ celebrated. Americans _ them with stony silence. The public's _ reaction made many veterans angry and _ them. They had _ a life-and-death struggle, obeying orders for their country's national _ .In the book Born on the Fourth of July (1976).Vietnam veteran Ron Kovic expressed his _ over their not being supported. "I didn't want to _ it at first---people went against us when we were putting our _ on the frontline for our country......How could they do this to us? Many of us wouldn't be coming back......" Thousands of Vietnam veterans turned to drugs or _ to kick the drug habits they had developed _ the war. Many others had trouble in finding jobs or _ down and starting families. Between 250,000 and 350,000 homeless Americans--nearly one third of the total _ Vietnam veterans.
